intro: Fuirena stephani, commonly known as the mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps and other mountainous regions in Europe. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other shrubs and evergreen plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, dense foliage, and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in landscape design.
